column4: is there software for like taking notes via a touchscreen notebook
whats the formal name for these notebooks?
yeah there you go
mm I believe so   I used one  a while back hold on
take a look here for some of the ones available and check out any screenshots you can fine    http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Category:Free_notetaking_software
although not strickly for note taking .. a really "decked out"  application would be lyx
however  lyx is at minmal 3 gigs  install
xournal is the one I used  with my wacom tablet
sudo apt-get install xournal      not  xjournal
there is another one neame    ejourn    older application with ecryption
yep its pretty cool... as I said there is also  ejourn   but I dont know if it will compile on
this suits my needs
yep :)  I think its a pretty nice application  for  tablet pc's  or wacom tablets
click on  "X Server Display Configuration"
is this nvidia , ati . or intel video?
is the driver installed
thats why you cant drag to the other monitor separate xscreens
open nvidia settings from terminal    sudo nvidia-settings
do you see both monitors in the graphics there?
click on the secondary monitor to set the resolution you want  then click  Configure  then choose Twinview
then click  Save to X configuration and close out,, then either reboot or restart x to see if it holds in twinview
have you ever run into this before?
